Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, interior slightly ribbed, with remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.102)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87611) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87611)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 113 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
